thread.title: Krzyzaniak gets shot at Cup title defence
thread.title_full: Krzyzaniak gets shot at Cup title defence

title: Krzyzaniak gets shot at Cup title defence
text:
Krzyzaniak gets shot at Cup title defence By: Uncredited FILE PHOTO Enlarge Image 
Halli Krzyzaniak, left, and Jamie Lee Rattray celebrate a goal by Canadian teammate Rebecca Johnston, centre, during last year’s Four Nationals Cup in Kamloops, B.C. Krzyzaniak and the Canadians will try to defend their title next month in Sweden. 
Neepawa’s Halli Krzyzaniak will rejoin the Canadian national women’s hockey team next month when they attempt to defend their Four Nations Cup title in Sweden. 
Krzyzaniak, is one of 13 veterans from last year’s Canadian team who earned their spots back at a tryout camp in Calgary last month. 
Brandonite Dwayne Gylywoychuk will serve as an assistant coach for Team Canada. 
The Four Nations Cup features Canada, Finland, Sweden and the United States in a tournament that will be staged in Sundsvall, Sweden this year. 
Canada plays Finland on Nov. 4, the United States on Nov. 5 and Sweden on Nov. 7. The bronze- and gold-medal games will be held on Nov. 8. 
Krzyzaniak is also one of seven players on the team who played on the women’s developmental squad in a three-game series against the United States in August. She won a silver medal with Canada at the women’s world championship in the spring. 
Canada has won gold 14 times and added five silvers since the Four Nations Cup started in 1996. 
Krzyzaniak currently plays at the University of North Dakota.
